meaningMnemonic: Cut <radical>grain</radical>s with a <radical>knife</radical> to make them smaller and you'll make a great <kanji>profit</kanji>. By cutting them, now you can get three grains worth of money for what was once a single grain.
readingMnemonic: To make an even better <kanji>profit</kanji>, you decide to cut up <reading>ree</reading>ds (り) too. You stuff the grains in the reeds and sell that as "self-cooking" sets.
